results.title: Thunderstruck
results.creator_credit: Darren Ashton, Jodi Matterson, Sony Music Australia, Showtime, Film Finance Corporation Australia and ICON
results.brief_description: Four mates go on the road with a mission - to scatter the ashes of a friend on the grave of Bon Scott, original frontman for rock band AC/DC. Struggling in their own way with adulthood, the lads get the band back together to live out their promise made to each other 12 years ago - that should any of them die they would be buried out West next to Scott. Living out this pact is harder than they think with a lot of obstacles getting in the way on their life-changing journey. Written and directed by Darren Ashton (co-writer Shaun Angus Hall). Cast includes Damon Gameau, Stephen Curry, Ryan Johnson, Callan Mulvey, Sam Worthington.

results.title: Super size me
results.creator_credit: Morgan Spurlock, The Con, Showtime Independent, Samuel Goldwyn Films and Roadside Attractions
results.brief_description: Eating nothing but McDonald’s for one month, Morgan Spurlock discovers the effects of fast-food first-hand. Under medical supervision, he proves by his experiment that junk food does make you sick - and while it is a bit extreme to eat “Maccas” three meals a day, the film shows how American society is making itself unwell by eating fast food in great amounts and that obesity is one of the largest causes of illness and death in the country. The “Super Size” refers to the larger sizes on offer and Morgan makes the rule that when offered a Super Size he must eat it! Winner of Best Director 2004 Sundance Film Festival.

results.title: The Hours
results.creator_credit: Stephen Daldry, Robert Fox, Scott Rudin, Miramax Films and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Faithful adaptation of Michael Cunningham’s acclaimed novel “The Hours”, garnered numerous Academy Award nominations including Best Actress prize for Nicole Kidman as Virginia Woolf. Using a three-episode structure the narrative shifts between the 1930s, 1950s and early 2000 with three women linked by the Woolf novel “Mrs Dalloway”. In the first part Woolf is depicted struggling with her novel and her waning mental health; next a suburban housewife and mother Laura Brown (Julianne Moore) is reading “Mrs Dalloway”, questioning her happiness and desire to live; lastly Clarissa Vaughn (Meryl Streep) is preparing a lavish dinner party for a dying friend who has won a celebrated literary prize. On this one day each woman experiences an array of emotions, including desire, despair and a yearning for something more; all are linked by motifs such as a kiss, interweaving their individual plights. As well the superb key performances, “The Hours” is bolstered by a strong supporting cast (Claire Danes, Ed Harris, Jeff Daniels, Allison Janney and Toni Collette), a lyrical Michael Nyman score and a pervasive air of melancholy and longing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Daldry, Robert Fox, Scott Rudin, Miramax Films and Paramount Pictures

results.title: Ring 0: Birthday = Ringu 0: Basudei
results.creator_credit: Norio Tsuruta, Masao Nagai, Takashige Ichise, Ring 0 Production Group and Asmik Ace Entertainment
results.brief_description: Ring O: Birthday, a prequel to the phenomenally successful “Ring” and “Ring 2” films by Hideo Nakata, provides the back-story of Sadako - the murdering, vengeful spirit that haunts the living via video-tape. Set in the 1960s, Sadako is a shy student, who earns the wrath of her colleagues when she attracts the attention of the drama club director. Suspicions about Sadako rise when mysterious deaths start to occur. With less thrills and shocks of the originals, “Ring 0” still impresses with its tension and dramatic staging of Sadako’s tragic past. Cast includes Yukie Nakama, Seiichi Tanabe and Yoshiko Tanaka.

results.title: A One and a two = Yi yi
results.creator_credit: Edward Yang, Naokto Tsukeda, Shinya Kawai, Pony Canyon, Omega Project and Atom Films
results.brief_description: A ruminative work of great beauty, contemplation and poignancy, “Yi-yi” is a film about three generations of a Taiwanese family, grappling with the notions of regret and acceptance of life’s turbulence. Director Edward Yang (highly regarded for his sprawling masterpiece “Brighter, sunny day”) shows great understanding of the human condition giving his protagonists space for introspection as they reflect over their fate. Winner of Best Director at Cannes 2000, this is an intelligent, detailed piece, which accumulates to create a complex tapestry — about alienation in modern life, dysfunctional families and the desire for happiness. Cast includes: Wu Nien-Jen, Kelly Lee, Elaine Jin, Chen Xisheng, and Jonathan Chang.

results.title: 24 Hour party people
results.creator_credit: Michael Winterbottom, Andrew Eaton, Baby Cow, Film Four International, Film Council, United Artists Corporation, Revolution Films and Film Consortium
results.brief_description: This mockumentary is set during Manchester’s rise in the music world from the late 70’s post punk era through to the 80’s rave scene. Inspired by the Sex Pistols Tony Wilson (Steve Coogan) a Cambridge graduate television presenter, starts a record label signing up the band “Joy Division” and then on to running the “Hacienda” nightclub. From depressive post punk morbidness comes “New Order” and then “Happy Mondays” are found. This hedonistic and exciting film shot on digital video shows well the life of drugs, excess and seedy dealing that go hand in hand with the music industry. “24 Hour Party People” is very funny. Those who were around during this important era will enjoy the soundtrack and reminisce to the sounds of “Joy Division”, “New Order”, “Buzzcocks”, “The Clash” and the “Happy Mondays”. Tough Northern humour, outrageous self abuse and self mocking throughout this is a fine portrayal of the Manchester music scene.

results.title: Thirteen conversations about one thing = 13 conversations ab
results.creator_credit: Jill Sprecher, Gina Resnick, Beni Atoori, Echo Lake Productions and Stonelock Pictures
results.brief_description: What is happiness? Through the journey of the everyday, five individuals’ lives link in a way that alters their fate or outlook. Karma, hope and fate are explored in this tale set in amongst busy city dwellers all with the need to answer life’s eternal questions of ‘what is life?’, ‘what’s in it for me?’ and even ‘how do I relate to others?’ Co-written and directed by Jill Sprecher. Stellar ensemble cast includes John Turturro, Matthew McConaughey, Clea DuVall, Amy Irving, Tia Texada, Barbara Sukowa, Alan Arkin.

results.title: Alexandra's project
results.creator_credit: Rolf De Heer, Domenico Procacci, Julie Ryan, South Australian Film Corporation, Palace Films and Fandango Australia
results.brief_description: What strange and sometimes nasty things go on behind closed doors in suburbia is what this feature, written and directed by Rolf de Heer, is all about. An emotionally spent housewife Alexandra (Helen Buday) organises a birthday surprise for her husband and father of her two children. After enduring years of financial and emotional shutdown at the hands of her husband (Gary Sweet), Alexandra seeks revenge and sets about to undo her husband to the level at which she feels she has been wronged. Set for the most part within the four walls of the family home “Alexandra’s Project” is a tense, sexual and unsettling drama. Nominated for five Australian Film Institute Awards and three IF Awards. Contains sex scenes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rolf De Heer, Domenico Procacci, Julie Ryan, South Australian Film Corporation, Palace Films and Fandango Australia

results.title: Morvern Callar
results.creator_credit: Lynne Ramsay, Robyn Slovo, George Faber, Charles Pattinson, BBC Film Unit and Alliance Atlantis
results.brief_description: After the death of her boyfriend a young aimless English woman living in the West of Scotland, assumes the authorship of his unpublished novel and absconds to Spain on a spiritual journey of self-discovery. Silently grieving and struggling to come to terms with his suicide, Morvern is an ambiguous character whose extreme actions belie her gentle, unassuming air. There is something wonderfully maladroit about Samantha Morton’s performance, expertly conveying Morvern’s despair, as she reconciles the calamitous events that subsequently turn to good fortune. The depressing milieu of the Scottish scenes contrast with Morvern’s liberation in sun drenched Spain as she begins to revel in her freedom.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynne Ramsay, Robyn Slovo, George Faber, Charles Pattinson, BBC Film Unit and Alliance Atlantis

results.title: Lilya 4-ever = Lilya forever [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lukas Moodysson, Lars Jonsson, Zentropa and Memfis
results.brief_description: Lukas Moodyson (Show me love, Together) delivers a bleak and melancholic story of a young Russian girl Lilya (Oksana Akinshina) who is abandoned by her mother (absconding to America with a boyfriend), deceived by her aunt and guardian and then betrayed by a friend who ruins Lilya’s reputation and consequently, her life. By a series of misunderstandings Lilya falls into prostitution and is then duped by an older man into believing a new life awaits her in the West. Once there however Lilya is forced into an array of humiliating and degrading circumstances that drive her to the brink. Set in the former Soviet Union, this is a somewhat desolate tale of dehumanisation, which contrasts starkly to the sunniness and humour of Moodyson’s “Together”, drawing on the grave themes of parent abandonment, child prostitution and human trafficking. Also available on VHS [318953].
